etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in James Dana (1813–1895), geologist, zoologist, and teacher. From German Mirabilit from classical Latin mīrābilis + German -it

definitions: Native hydrated sodium sulphate, Na₂ SO₄ ·10H₂ O, a monoclinic mineral usually occurring as colourless prisms or massive deposits, especially near salt springs or lakes, and in caves. Also called Glauber's salt.
